intro: Palicourea maguireorum, commonly known as the Maguire's palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with white to pale yellow petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
